FuncDef:
The nat time local command configures the time displayed in logs as the local time.
The undo nat time local command cancels the time displayed in logs as the local time.
By default, the time displayed in logs is the UTC time.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure the time displayed in syslogs as the local time, run the nat time local command.
Prerequisites
Create a flexible NAT log template and enter the flexible NAT log template view.
